name: The Partridge Inn

reviews.text: The pictures looked good but up close and in real time not so great. There was no baggage person, not that I am not used to carrying my own bags. Check in was normal except we over heard the phone conversation of one desk clerk advising someone the rumors were not true and the hotel was open for business. Elavators were adequate. Rooms were small but the balconies were as large as the rooms. The bathroom was old with a fiberglass tub surround. The fixtures were floating through the wall and were loose. The toilet took a long time to flush. The TV was a flat screen. Air conditioning had a musty smell like you sometimes get in the Carribian. The floors creaked and some places they were not level. Windows did not keep out noise. WI-Fi worked well however there was no room safe. The place reminded me of visits to old relatives homes back in the 50's, it was that old. We were invited to the penthouse for a party and it was decorated in pre 1970 style only it was real.The view from the deck on the sixth floor was very nice, but upkeep on the treated wood and furniture left a lot to be desired. Railing around the top were sagging and the rope lighting was not working more than working.Bugs that some of the people who lived in the area called pomento bugs were visible after dark all around the deck. I have my own idea what they were but I am not a bug expert. Walking through the kitchen there was a weird smell even different than a musty smell. The hall bathroom in the penthouse worked but it was terrible looking. Not what you would expect from the penthouse. Ceiling were not very high and there were no ceiling fans.
reviews.title: Tired old building

reviews.text: Meals. We only ate breakfast. It was a buffet. Nothing to rave about for $12.50 a person. There was no complimentary coffee for guest. After the first night our room card stopped working and again on the second morning which required a trip to the front desk both times. It was like being in an old bed and breakfast except we did not have to share a bathroom. Someone asked me what I thought of the hotel and I replied being as nice as possible that " she was a tired old girl ". I have stayed in a lot nicer hotels for a whole lot less.
reviews.title: Southern charm at its best

reviews.text: My husband and I were passing through Augusta on our way to Charleston, so I purchased a Groupon for the Partridge Inn. The service was impeccable. We asked for a balcony room and they accommodated us. Every staff member we met was extremely friendly. We absolutely loved the rocking chairs and the view from the balcony. Our room was very clean and cozy. The breakfast was delicious. We would definitely return to this lovely inn.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere!

reviews.text: Nice spot. It's an older, more historic-type hotel. Reminds me of New Orleans. The restaurant (P.I.) was EXCELLENT!!! Great rack of lamb, pecan pie, and the best rice pilaf I have rver tasted in my life! The rooms could use some upgrade work. Don't get a room on the third floor! It's right above the restaurant and the live music will make for a noisy stay. I had to switch rooms.
reviews.title: Old Time Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was so pleased by the friendliness of the staff and the beauty of our accommodation. Some my not like an historic hotel, but I loved it. So much history.
reviews.title: Old Historic Inn but overall a GREAT stay!!

reviews.text: I hosted an 80th birthday gathering for my mother. Don't tell her I listed her age:) The staff at the Partridge Inn took care of every detail and our celebration was complete with the charming guitarist singing a smooth and silky "Happy Birthday" song. Our waiter, June, was everywhere we needed her to be and made a special effort to insure that all of our needs were met. Thank you, Partridge Inn, for making this milestone celebration memorable.
reviews.title: The Sunday Brunch was excellent...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there over the weekend with my girlfriend. I was concerned when I saw some of the reviews on here. I must say, " Go and experience it for yourself." My server kim was excellent. I was greeted by a smile at the desk from Nick all weekend long. With a smile like his there is no way you could have a bad stay. this hotel is surely worth experiencing.
reviews.title: Hospitality at it's best

reviews.text: My tennis team and I stayed here recently and I had an excellent experience. The rooms were spacious and extremely clean. The hotel staff was top notch! Any time I encountered hotel staff, they were always friendly and asked if there was anything I needed. Great food, excellent location and the atmosphere was great! We enjoyed breakfast on the front porch and dancing in the lounge to live music. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and hope that I get the opportunity to stay there again.
reviews.title: Fun Atmosphere

reviews.text: The Partridge Inn has a wonderfully accommodating and friendly staff. The rooms were spacious and clean. The outdoor dining and bar areas were lovely. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.text: My tennis team stayed at the Partridge Inn in Augusta while at the USTA State playoffs and had the most fantastic time. The staff is amazing and the hotel is so unique. My room was very nice with a big comfy bed. We enjoyed the food and the bar was so much fun! I will stay there again and I highly recommend it to others.
reviews.title: USTA State Playoffs

reviews.text: ... stay here. Yes, it's a little old around the edges, but it's by far the most charming hotel in Augusta. I've spent many nights here over the last few years, and I would say that the staff is lovely and friendly, the restaurant is quite good, and the rooms are comfortable enough (be sure to request a room with a balcony... these have rocking chairs for enjoying a warm Southern evening).
reviews.title: When in Augusta...
ESouthern Charm during the Masters
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel during the Masters and have to say it's full of southern charm and added to the overall experience of staying in Augusta and watching the Masters. Some pros & cons:
Pros:
reviews.title: Love Historic Hotels
Dated rooms but great food and customer service
reviews.text: - rooms very spacious and beds were comfortable
- staff was always friendly
reviews.title: A few issues

reviews.text: I rely on reviews when booking a hotel, however,wanted to stay where my graduate Med Student started her journey 4 yrs ago. Our reservation for 3 rooms for last wk, was made for 1 rm a wk later, my 86 yr old mom was given 3 rooms in 24 hrs with issues from unsafe torn carpet,tile, non working door lock, and last rm had no working phone,tissue,garbage can,fridge,microwave.When I complained as my mother is barely able to walk, the desk clerks, the last one was Heyward, were rude,discourteous, and just do not care. Have traveled extensively, never had an experience like this. No follow up at all, management could not be bothered, please don't waste your money or more to the point, no one needs this kind of frustrating experience. Buyers beware - book elsewhere!!
reviews.title: May 10 - 11 Medical College Graduation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very romantic historical inn. Stayed at this inn on my wife's birthday. Overall stay was very pleasant
reviews.title: Romantic stay

reviews.text: We just had a very short stay here at the Partridge Inn, but I loved how quaint and how comfortable it was. The room was HUGE...room to dance, we laughed. Coming from New England, I am used to old and uneven and love it. The staff was very friendly. We checked in late on afternoon and left early the following morning as we were there only for a high school golf tournament, but I would love to go back and soak in the history of the old inn.
reviews.title: Quick Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being from Augusta we were very familiar with the Historic PI and decided to stay there during our visit home to see our kids. Spent four nights in room 311 and have to say we were sad to find the room to be a bit run down and in need of repair. First let me say the bed was one of the most comfortable in a hotel I have slept in. The room was clean and comfortable with a coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, and flat screen TV. There was a closet to hang clothes and a dresser drawer for storage. Now the part I wish I didn't have to report. The bathroom was a disaster. The bath towel bar behind the door was bent (tacky) ok, accidents happen but the housekeeping should report it and it should be replaced immediately. The bathroom was fairly large and the toilet was back in a little nook on the oposite wall from the teeny tiny sink where there was no hand towel,,,,after looking around I located it hanging over the toilet. WHY? I used the cord from the hairdryer to hang the handtowel on to use when I washed my hands. The shower had only a small soap dish and no place to put shampoo, etc on while showering,,also there was nothing to hang onto if you slipped on the wet tiles. The worst thing for me was the broken floor tiles and the loose grout that stuck to my feet when barefoot, I used all the bath towels to cover the floor so I could walk around. I also need to express my surprise at the breakfast buffet that cost $8.00 for coffee, juice, fruit, & muffins,,,no way, go to Waffle House or I Hop to get your moneys worth. The front desk was very courtious and listened to my complaint about the bathroom and said they would e-mail me with an update, well, been home a week and have heard nothing. Also couldn't use the pool because it was "out-of-order".
reviews.title: Spring Break Visit Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personnel are very friendly and willing to help. Room and bath were clean - being a historic type hotel this is a pleasure to feel you are in a clean environment. Would recommend!
reviews.title: A good historic place to sleep

description: A hotel is first and foremost lodging, and at The Partridge Inn, we excel at providing you with world-class living quarters. Upon arrival at our full-service, newly refurbished hotel, you'll discover why more than a century's worth of travelers have made us the preferred choice of Augusta accommodations. Here, a deep sense of history and tradition endures amid warm woods, breezy walkways, overstuffed sofas, loveseats, and covered outdoor verandahs. Delight in a tranquil ambiance that -- while just minutes from the excitement of downtown -- transports you to the gentler rhythms of the Old South. A truly unique address for business and leisure travelers alike
